CONJUGATES: parents (n plural) | parents (v 3rd person singular present) | parenting (v present participle) | parented (v past tense, past participle)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old French parent, from Latin parentem (nominative parens), present participle of parere 'bring forth, give birth to, produce'

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A mother or father of a person or an animal.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一个人或动物的父亲或母亲。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Both parents attended the school meeting to discuss their child's progress.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 父母双方都参加了学校会议，讨论他们孩子的进步。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An organization, company, or system from which another is derived; a source or origin.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 另一个组织、公司或系统的起源；来源或根源。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The parent company decided to spin off its software division.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 母公司决定分拆其软件部门。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Transitive verb: a verb that takes one or more objects.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To raise and care for a child as a parent.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 抚养和照料孩子，履行父母职责。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: It takes a lot of patience and love to parent effectively.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 有效地为人父母需要很多耐心和爱。
